meanings.definition: To tax insufficiently or at too low a rate.
meanings.sent1: The government is undertaxing the wealthy individuals in our society.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to undertax businesses to ensure proper funding for public services.
meanings.sent3: The idea of undertaxing the millionaires seemed like a joke to the citizens.
meanings.sent4: By undertaxing the corporations, the government is missing out on potential revenue.
meanings.sent5: Undertaxing the top earners may lead to budget deficits in the long run.

meanings.definition: To impose too light a tax burden on.
meanings.sent1: The new policy aims to prevent undertaxing small businesses.
meanings.sent2: Governments should avoid undertaxing low-income families to promote economic equality.
meanings.sent3: The idea of undertaxing the middle class was met with skepticism by economists.
meanings.sent4: By undertaxing certain industries, the government may inadvertently create unfair advantages.
meanings.sent5: Undertaxing essential services can have negative consequences on public welfare.
